other_tests.findings: Partial removal of a GH-secreting macroadenoma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Three months after TSS, GH levels and IGF-1 levels were normalized.

other_tests.findings: Diagnosis of pheochromocytoma confirmed by histology.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Ten months later, plasma and urinary norms showed significant decreases in catecholamines.

other_tests.findings: Elevated GH (10.70 ng/ml) and IGF-I (492 ng/ml); also elevated plasma norepinephrine (847 pg/ml) and urine normetanephrine (3506 µg/24h).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Plasma norepinephrine decreased to 361 pg/ml and urine normetanephrine to 727 µg/24h, showing an improvement.

other_tests.findings: Down-regulation of SDHD protein in the GH-secreting adenoma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Compared with normal pituitary tissue, where SDHD was strongly expressed.

other_tests.findings: Succinate dehydrogenase activity was reduced by 15–20% in tumor tissue compared to control.
